rev.diff:
Line 44: Line 44:
==Reception and adoption==
==Reception and adoption==
â
''Super OS'' has been received mainly with positive reviews, with [[softpedia]] saying ''"it is a distribution with super powers [...] [due to] the inclusion of applications, tools and technologies that are missing from a standard Ubuntu"''<ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/It-039-s-a-Bird-It-039-s-a-Plane-It-039-s-Super-Ubuntu-101085.shtml</ref>. ''Super OS'' (still with the name ''Super Ubuntu'' at the time), was also [[Lifehacker]]'s ''featured download'' saying "''It's basically just a re-compiled version of the official Ubuntu distribution, but with a whole bunch of features included that save you the time of grabbing them yourself''"<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5123360/super-ubuntu-rolls-multimedia-and-helpful-extras-into-ubuntu</ref>. [[App Runner]] (a tool included in ''Super OS'') was also subject of an article by Lifehacker, saying "''App Runner would come in handy''" and "''there's plenty of scripts and closed-source apps that this would be useful for''"<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5224675/app-runner-makes-launching-linux-executables-easier</ref>. ''Super OS'' is also the [[Operating System|OS]] that the [http://www.fixedbylinux.com/about Helios project] (a non-profit organization to give away computers to children without the money to buy them) pre-loads on most of the computers they give away.<ref>http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Helios Helios at hacktolive.org</ref><ref>http://linuxlock.blogspot.com/2009/05/living-to-hack-and-getting-it-done.html Living To Hack and Getting It Done (official Blog of Helios project)</ref>
+
''Super OS'' has been received mainly with positive reviews, with [[softpedia]] saying ''"it is a distribution with super powers [...] [due to] the inclusion of applications, tools and technologies that are missing from a standard Ubuntu"''<ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/It-039-s-a-Bird-It-039-s-a-Plane-It-039-s-Super-Ubuntu-101085.shtml</ref>. ''Super OS'' (still with the name ''Super Ubuntu'' at the time), was also [[Lifehacker]]'s ''featured download'' saying "''It's basically just a re-compiled version of the official Ubuntu distribution, but with a whole bunch of features included that save you the time of grabbing them yourself''"<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5123360/super-ubuntu-rolls-multimedia-and-helpful-extras-into-ubuntu</ref>. [[App Runner]] (a tool included in ''Super OS'') was also subject of an article by Lifehacker, saying "''App Runner would come in handy''" and "''there's plenty of scripts and closed-source apps that this would be useful for''"<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5224675/app-runner-makes-launching-linux-executables-easier</ref>. ''Super OS'' is also the [[Operating System|OS]] that the [http://www.fixedbylinux.com/about Helios project] (a non-profit organization to give away computers to children without the money to buy them) pre-loads on most of the computers they give away.<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/wiki/Helios Helios at hacktolive.org]</ref><ref>[http://linuxlock.blogspot.com/2009/05/living-to-hack-and-getting-it-done.html Living To Hack and Getting It Done (official Blog of Helios project)]</ref>
